name: 🦸‍♂️ Vintage VHS: Superman – Silver Star Video (1989)
description:
🦸‍♂️ Vintage VHS: Superman – Silver Star Video (1989)

Label: Silver Star Video, Inc.
Title: Superman – Featuring “The Mechanical Monster,” “Superman,” and “The Mummy Strikes”
Format: VHS, NTSC
Runtime: Approx. 30 minutes
Genre: Animated Public Domain Superhero Classics
Sticker Price: $1.00 (original retail tag still intact!)

Up, up, and away! 🚀 Rewind your Saturday mornings with this vintage Silver Star Video VHS featuring three action-packed Superman cartoons from the legendary Fleischer Studios. Released in the golden days of corner video stores and cardboard clamshells, this tape delivers cape-swirling heroics on a budget — just how we liked it in the ’80s.

📼 A true time capsule, this tape is dripping with analog charm:
	•	Classic hand-drawn animation
	•	A brilliant (and slightly off-model) Superman cover
	•	Public domain magic from a label that danced in the legal gray like a Kryptonian moonwalker

Includes:
	•	The Mechanical Monster (a Fleischer favorite featuring robot mayhem)
	•	Superman (the very first 1941 short)
	•	The Mummy Strikes (mystery and pulp horror vibes)

Perfect for collectors, retro archivists, or anyone building a nostalgia shrine to the analog era.

⸻

💵 Current Value Estimate (2025)

Based on recent eBay and vintage media sales data:

Condition	Estimated Value	Notes
Sealed	$10–$20	Rare, usually from collectors or deadstock
Very Good (played, intact case/label)	$5–$8	More common, especially if label art is vibrant
Worn / Label Fading / Cracked case	$1–$3	Basically nostalgia value only
Sold Listings on eBay (2024–2025)	$2–$12	Varies by title and character featured.

PriceIncludes a digital copy of the tape playthrough,and, of course shipping.
